aboutUs.missionText: To deliver reliable, eco-friendly biomass heating systems that reduce energy costs, lower carbon emissions, and help industries move toward sustainable growth.

aboutUs.whyBiomassTitle: Why Biomass Wood Pellets/ Loose biomass?
aboutUs.whyBiomassPoint1: Renewable and carbon-neutral fuel, manufactured from wood waste and agro residues.
aboutUs.whyBiomassPoint2: Cleaner combustion with significantly lower CO₂, NOx and SOx emissions than fossil fuels.
aboutUs.whyBiomassPoint3: Effective Calorific value 3,800–4,500 kcal/kg for delivering steady thermal output.
aboutUs.whyBiomassPoint4: Reduces Fuel Cost by 30–50% versus diesel, Oil (LDO/FO) and Gas (LPG/PNG/Propane).
aboutUs.whyBiomassPoint5: Low moisture (6–10%) ensures complete combustion and low ash (1–2%) reduces cleaning of system.
aboutUs.whyBiomassPoint6: Consistent Quality and Year-round availability of pellets across India.
aboutUs.whyBiomassPoint7: Easy to Store, Handle and Transport.

ourJourney.title: Our Journey
ourJourney.description: A timeline of our growth and innovation in biomass heating solutions
ourJourney.journey1Desc: We began in 2017 by manufacturing pellet stoves and circular batch fryers, marking our entry into biomass fired heating solutions for small and mid-scale food units.
ourJourney.journey2Desc: In 2018, we expanded into pellet burners, offering industries a cleaner and more economical alternative to LPG and diesel for consistent thermal processing.
ourJourney.journey3Desc: By 2019, we developed hot-air generators, enabling efficient heating for roasting, drying, and various continuous process applications across multiple industries.
ourJourney.journey4Desc: In 2020, our systems reached multiple sectors including food, packaging, textile and chemical industries, accelerating the shift from LPG and diesel to biomass.
ourJourney.journey5Desc: We launched high-capacity pellet burners and upgraded heat exchanger systems in 2022, supporting larger plants with efficient high-temperature performance.
ourJourney.journey6Desc: In 2023, we introduced our biomass-fired aluminum melting furnace, offering a cost-effective and eco-friendly alternative for metal heating and melting operations.
ourJourney.journey7Desc: 2024 focused on R&D, where we improved combustion efficiency, automation, and robustness along with offering more customized heating solutions.
ourJourney.journey8Desc: By 2025, we became a trusted biomass heating partner with widespread installations and solutions focused on sustainability, efficiency, and dependable industrial performance.

blog.blog1Title: Decoding the ROI: Why Transitioning to High-Efficiency Biomass Pellet Burners Makes Financial Sense for Indian Industry
blog.blog1Excerpt: In the current Indian industrial landscape, energy costs constitute a massive portion of operational overheads. With volatile prices for fossil fuels like Diesel, LDO (Light Diesel Oil), and LPG, manufacturers are actively seeking sustainable alternatives.
blog.blog1Introduction: In the current Indian industrial landscape, energy costs constitute a massive portion of operational overheads. With volatile prices for fossil fuels like Diesel, LDO (Light Diesel Oil), and LPG, manufacturers are actively seeking sustainable alternatives. Giriraj addresses this critical need by manufacturing high-efficiency biomass-fired heating systems. This post analyzes the technical and economic advantages of switching to our Wood Pellet Burners, supported by comparative data.
blog.blog1Section1Heading: The Technical Edge: Biomass Pellet Burners
blog.blog1Section1Content: Our flagship Wood Pellet Burner is engineered for continuous, heavy-duty industrial use. Unlike traditional systems that struggle with fuel consistency, these burners are designed to utilize biomass pellets with an effective calorific value of 3,800–4,500 kcal/kg.
blog.blog1Section1Point1: Thermal Efficiency: The system achieves combustion efficiency of up to 92%, ensuring minimal heat loss.
blog.blog1Section1Point2: Capacity Range: From 1,00,000 to 25,00,000 kcal/hr, making it scalable for various industrial loads.
blog.blog1Section1Point3: Material Science: We offer options in Mild Steel (MS) or Stainless Steel (SS) with ceramic insulation, crucial for maintaining structural integrity under high heat. Notably, Giriraj is a developer of an SS combustion chamber-based series, ensuring longer service life compared to standard market offerings.
blog.blog1Section2Heading: The Financial Breakdown: Pellets vs. Fossil Fuels
blog.blog1Section2Content: The most compelling argument for the switch is the drastic reduction in fuel costs—typically 30–50% versus Diesel, Oil, and Gas. Based on current market rates, the savings are quantifiable.
blog.blog1Section2Details: As per current data available, fossil fuels possess higher calorific values per unit, the cost to generate the equivalent amount of heat is significantly higher. For example, to match the heat output of pellets costing ₹15, one would spend approximately ₹40 on Diesel, resulting in a 56% saving for the user.
blog.blog1Section3Content: Beyond economics, the burner supports our mission to lower carbon emissions. Biomass pellets are carbon-neutral and offer significantly lower CO₂, NOx, and SOx emissions compared to fossil fuels. Furthermore, the low moisture content (6–10%) ensures complete combustion, while low ash content (1–2%) reduces the frequency of system cleaning, minimizing downtime.
blog.blog1Section4Content: With over 700 installations running effectively across India, Giriraj's biomass pellet burners offer a proven pathway to reducing energy costs without compromising on thermal output. For industries looking to stabilize operational costs, the math is simple: biomass is the future.
blog.blog2Title: Precision Heating for the Food Industry: The Advantages of Biomass-Fired Batch Fryers
blog.blog2Excerpt: In the food processing sector—specifically for manufacturers of namkeen, chips, and fried snacks—temperature consistency is the key to product quality. However, achieving this consistency often comes at a high fuel cost.
blog.blog2Introduction: In the food processing sector—specifically for manufacturers of namkeen, chips, and fried snacks—temperature consistency is the key to product quality. However, achieving this consistency often comes at a high fuel cost. Giriraj introduces a sustainable solution: Biomass-Fired Batch Fryers (Circular and Rectangular) designed specifically for food processing industries seeking consistent quality and fuel savings.
blog.blog2Section1Content: The food industry demands equipment that meets strict hygiene standards. Our batch fryers are constructed using SS 304 food-grade material for the fry pan, ensuring safety and compliance. This is supported by an MS/SS support structure and high-density ceramic wool insulation to prevent heat loss and protect operators.
blog.blog2Section1Point1: Fryer Range: Available in diameters ranging from 24'' to 60''.
blog.blog2Section1Point2: Temperature Control: The system features digital oil-temperature control, allowing for precise thermal management. This prevents the overheating of oil, which is critical for maintaining the taste and shelf-life of fried products.
blog.blog2Section2Content: Transitioning from Diesel or LPG to biomass pellets in a frying setup does not mean sacrificing control. Our systems utilize pellets with a consistent calorific value (3,800–4,500 kcal/kg) to deliver steady thermal output.
blog.blog2Section2Point1: Fuel Efficiency: Users can expect a fuel cost reduction of 30–50% compared to Diesel or LPG.
blog.blog2Section2Point2: Clean Operation: The pellets have a very low ash content (1–2%), which keeps the production environment cleaner than coal or wood-fired alternatives.
blog.blog2Section3Content: While the Circular Batch Fryer is a staple, we also offer Rectangular configurations to suit different production line layouts. The system handles biomass pellets or loose biomass, giving manufacturers flexibility based on fuel availability. Given that pellets are available year-round across India and are easy to store and transport, supply chain interruptions are minimized.
blog.blog2Section4Content: Giriraj's Batch Fryers represent the intersection of food technology and sustainable engineering. By adopting these systems, food processors can maintain the high quality of their snacks while aligning with a vision of operating efficiently and responsibly.
blog.blog3Title: Optimizing Thermal Efficiency in Drying Applications: The Indirect Hot Air Generator
blog.blog3Excerpt: From textiles to pharmaceuticals, drying is a critical process step that consumes vast amounts of energy. The challenge lies in generating high temperatures without contaminating the product with combustion gases.
blog.blog3Introduction: From textiles to pharmaceuticals, drying is a critical process step that consumes vast amounts of energy. The challenge lies in generating high temperatures without contaminating the product with combustion gases. Giriraj's Industrial-grade Indirect Hot Air Generator (HAG) is engineered to solve this by providing clean, uniform hot air with reduced energy consumption.
blog.blog3Section1Content: Direct heating often exposes products to smoke and ash. Our Indirect HAGs utilize a sophisticated heat exchanger design to ensure that the air contacting your product is 100% clean.
blog.blog3Section1Point1: Heat Exchanger: The core of the system is an MS/SS multi-pass high-efficiency design. This maximizes the surface area for heat transfer, ensuring that the energy from the biomass fuel is effectively transferred to the process air.
blog.blog3Section1Point2: Temperature Output: The system can generate clean hot air up to 250°C, making it suitable for high-demand drying applications in packaging, printing, and chemicals.
blog.blog3Section2Content: Designed for scalability, the Hot Air Generator offers a capacity range of 1,00,000 – 10,00,000 kcal/hr, customizable based on specific airflow and pressure requirements.
blog.blog3Section2Point1: Insulation: We utilize high-grade ceramic wool to insulate the system, preventing ambient heat loss and improving overall safety.
blog.blog3Section2Point2: Automation: The unit comes with a Digital or PLC-based control panel, allowing operators to maintain stable temperatures with minimal manual intervention.
blog.blog3Section3Content: Industries such as Textiles, Pharmaceuticals, and Paper/Packaging often have high carbon footprints due to thermal energy requirements. By switching to a biomass-fired HAG, these sectors can utilize a renewable, carbon-neutral fuel.
blog.blog3Section3Point1: Emission Control: The cleaner combustion of pellets results in significantly lower NOx and SOx emissions compared to conventional fossil fuels.
blog.blog3Section3Point2: Maintenance: The system is designed for minimal maintenance, supported by our 24/7 technical support team.
blog.blog3Section4Content: For industries requiring precise, clean drying temperatures, the Giriraj Indirect Hot Air Generator offers a robust solution. It combines the economic benefits of biomass—saving up to 50% against LPG—with the technical precision required for modern manufacturing.

faq.question1: How much fuel cost savings can I expect with biomass pellets?
faq.answer1: Biomass pellets usually reduce fuel costs by 30–50% compared to diesel/LPG/LDO because pellet fuel is cheaper per unit heat.
faq.question2: What maintenance do biomass pellet burners need?
faq.answer2: Mainly ash cleaning once a day and occasional inspection.
faq.answer3: Yes, pellets are available year-round from wood/agro-waste suppliers.
faq.question4: Are biomass heating systems suitable for food processing?
faq.answer4: Yes, our batch fryers use SS 304 food-grade material and deliver safe, uniform, fuel-efficient heating.
faq.question5: What type of fuel can be used in the system?
faq.answer5: The system runs on biomass pellets; some models accept loose biomass, wood chips, or agro-waste, depending on configuration.
faq.question6: How much ash is produced from pellets?
faq.answer6: Typically 1–2% ash, making cleaning and disposal easy.
faq.question7: Do pellet burners emit smoke or odor?
faq.answer7: Pellets burn with low smoke and minimal smell due to high calorific value and controlled combustion.
faq.question8: Is the system suitable for 24/7 industrial use?
faq.answer8: Yes, units are designed for continuous heavy-duty operation.
faq.answer9: Typically 6–15 months, depending on operating hours and fuel cost.
faq.answer10: Yes, we offer installation, training, and spare parts support.
